org.czentral.util.stream

Class Buffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.czentral.util.stream.Buffer

  • public class Buffer
extends java.lang.Object
    A byte array based buffer. The payload can be an arbitrary region of the array.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Buffer(byte[] buffer, int offset, int length)
      Creates a StreamBuffer backed by the given array.
      Buffer(int size)
      Creates a StreamBuffer with the given size.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void compact()
      Moves the payload of this buffer to the start of the array.
      byte[] getData()
      Gets the array containing the data of this buffer.
      int getLength()
      Gets the number of bytes containing the data of this buffer.
      int getOffset()
      Gets the offset of the first byte containing the data of this buffer inside the buffer array.
      void markAppended(int numOfBytes)
      Signals that numOfBytes bytes of new data has been appended to the end of the payload.
      void markProcessed(int numOfBytes)
      Signals that the first numOfBytes bytes has been processed and should not be considered as part of the payload anymore.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Buffer

        public Buffer(int size)
        Creates a StreamBuffer with the given size.
        Parameters:
        size - Desired capacity of the buffer.

      • Buffer

        public Buffer(byte[] buffer,
      int offset,
      int length)
        Creates a StreamBuffer backed by the given array. Contents of the given array will be changed by the object.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Array to use.
        offset - Beginning of data in the buffer.
        length - Length of data.

    • Method Detail

      • compact

        public void compact()
        Moves the payload of this buffer to the start of the array.

      • getData

        public byte[] getData()
        Gets the array containing the data of this buffer.

      • getOffset

        public int getOffset()
        Gets the offset of the first byte containing the data of this buffer inside the buffer array.

      • markProcessed

        public void markProcessed(int numOfBytes)
        Signals that the first numOfBytes bytes has been processed and should not be considered as part of the payload anymore.
        Parameters:
        numOfBytes - The number of bytes processed.

      • markAppended

        public void markAppended(int numOfBytes)
        Signals that numOfBytes bytes of new data has been appended to the end of the payload.
        Parameters:
        numOfBytes - The number of bytes appended.

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Gets the number of bytes containing the data of this buffer.
